Quick Setup Guide:
Space Base - Quick Setup & Gameplay Overview

Setup:

Prepare the Game Components:

Place the main deck of ship cards in the center.

Separate and set aside Level 1, 2, and 3 ship cards in their respective decks.

Place the colony cards nearby.

Player Setup:

Each player takes a Player Board.

Place 12 starting ship cards in their designated slots (1-12) in active mode (blue).

Each player starts with 5 credits. The second player gains 1 additional credit, the third player gains 2 additional credits, the fourth and fifth players gain 1 income instead of extra credits..

Take one Level 1 ship card for free and replace the open market slot.

Determine First Player:

The last player to have flown in an airplane goes first.

Turn order proceeds clockwise.

Basic Gameplay Overview:

Roll Dice & Gain Rewards:

The active player rolls two dice.

They may choose to take each die separately or sum them to activate rewards on the corresponding numbered slots.

Other Players Also Gain Rewards:

Non-active players activate red abilities from ships they have deployed (purchased ships moved under their board).

Buy New Ships or Colonies:

The active player may purchase a ship from the market using credits.

The purchased ship replaces the existing one in its numbered slot.

The replaced ship is turned upside down and moved under the board, unlocking red abilities.

Game Continues Until a Player Reaches 40 Victory Points, triggering a final round where all players get an equal number of turns:

The round is completed so all players have an equal number of turns.

The player with the most points wins!

Lost Ruins of Arnak - Quick Setup & Gameplay Overview

Setup:

Prepare the Game Board:

Place the main board in the center of the play area, ensuring the correct side is facing up based on player count.
Shuffle the Artifact and Item cards separately, placing them face-down on their designated spaces. Reveal the top five Item cards to form the item market.
Place the Idol tokens on the unexplored site spaces (Level 1 and Level 2 sites) as indicated.
Shuffle the Site and Guardian tiles separately, placing them face-down near the board.
Arrange the Research Track components:
Place the Research tokens (magnifying glass and notebook) of each player at the bottom of the track.
Shuffle and place the Research bonus tiles face-up on their designated spaces.
Stack the Temple tiles at the top of the track.
Player Setup:

Each player selects a color and receives:
A player board.
Two Archaeologist figures.
A set of Starting cards: two Funding cards, two Exploration cards, and two Fear cards.
Players shuffle their Starting cards to form their personal deck and draw a starting hand of five cards.
Distribute initial resources based on turn order:
The first player receives:
2 Coins
1 Compass
The second player receives:
2 Coins
2 Compasses
The third player receives:
3 Coins
2 Compasses
The fourth player receives:
4 Coins
2 Compasses
Market & Supply Setup:

Place the Moon Staff on the leftmost space of the Card Row to indicate the first round.
Arrange the Resource tokens (Coins, Compasses, Arrowheads, Tablets, and Jewels) in separate piles accessible to all players.
Keep the Assistant tiles nearby for when players advance on the Research Track.
Basic Gameplay Overview:

Player Actions:

Players take turns performing one main action per turn, with optional free actions. Main actions include:
Dig at a Site: Send an archaeologist to an existing site by paying the required travel cost to gain the site's resources.
Discover a New Site: Explore a new Level 1 or Level 2 site by paying the necessary compasses and placing an archaeologist there. Draw a Site tile to reveal its resources and place a Guardian tile on the site.
Buy a Card: Purchase an Item or Artifact card by paying its cost. Items are placed at the bottom of your deck; Artifacts trigger their effect immediately.
Play a Card: Use a card from your hand for its effect, then place it in your play area.
Research: Advance your token on the Research Track by paying the required resources to gain bonuses and victory points.
Overcome a Guardian: Defeat a Guardian at your archaeologist's location by paying its resource cost to earn victory points and avoid penalties.
End of Round:

After all players have passed, the round ends. Perform the following steps:
Retrieve Archaeologists: Return all archaeologists to their owners.
Refresh the Card Row: Remove the leftmost card (next to the Moon Staff) from the market and slide remaining cards to the left. Fill empty spaces with new cards from the corresponding deck.
Move the Moon Staff: Advance the Moon Staff one space to the right to indicate the next round.
Players' Maintenance: Each player discards any remaining cards in hand, then draws five new cards from their deck. If the deck is exhausted, shuffle the discard pile to form a new deck.
End of Game & Scoring:

The game concludes after five rounds. Players then calculate their final scores based on:
Research Track Position: Points for the highest position reached and bonuses acquired.
Temple Tiles: Points from any temple tiles obtained.
Idol Tokens: Points from idols collected, minus any used for immediate benefits.
Defeated Guardians: Each Guardian overcome grants additional points.
Cards: Some Item and Artifact cards provide end-game points.
Fear Cards: Each Fear card subtracts points from the total.
The player with the highest total score is declared the winner.

Kingdomino - Quick Setup & Gameplay Overview

Setup:

Prepare the Tiles:

Shuffle all domino tiles and place them in a face-down draw pile.

Depending on the player count, remove specific tiles:

2 Players: Use all tiles.

3 Players: Remove 12 tiles.

4 Players: Use all tiles.

Player Setup:

Each player takes a starting square tile and a castle.

Each player takes a colored king pawn (two per player in a 2-player game, one otherwise).

Randomly determine player order.

Prepare the Drafting Row:

Draw four dominoes from the stack and place them face-up in numerical order.

Players take turns placing their king pawn on a tile to claim it.

Basic Gameplay Overview:

Tile Selection:

Players select tiles in the order of their king pawn placement.

New tiles are drawn and arranged for the next round.

Placing Tiles:

The selected tile must be placed in a 5x5 grid adjacent to an existing tile.

At least one side of the new tile must match a terrain type of an adjacent tile.

Game End & Scoring:

The game ends after all tiles are placed.

Players score points by multiplying the number of connected matching terrain squares by the number of crowns in that terrain.

The player with the highest score wins!

Mechanics: Engine-building, tableau-building, card drafting, action selection
Quick Setup Guide:
Earth - Quick Setup & Gameplay Overview

Setup:

Prepare the Main Board:

Place the Fauna Board in the center.

Shuffle and place Fauna Cards face-up on the board.

Shuffle Ecosystem Cards and place one face-up per player.

Shuffle Island and Climate Cards, then deal one of each per player.

Prepare the Decks:

Shuffle Earth Cards (green deck) and place them as a draw pile.

Place Soil, Sprout, Trunk, and Growth tokens in general supply.

Player Setup:

Each player chooses an Island and Climate card.

Draw six Earth Cards and keep four.

Start with Soil as determined by your Island Card.

Each player takes a Player Board.

Take five Fauna Leaf tokens.

Starting Player:

The last person who watered a plant goes first.

Basic Gameplay Overview:

Active Player Chooses an Action (all players perform an action, but the active player gets a bonus):

Plant: Place Earth cards in your tableau by spending Soil.

Compost: Gain Soil and compost cards for endgame points.

Water: Gain Sprouts for extra points.

Grow: Gain Growth to develop trees for points.

All Players Activate Matching Color Abilities:

Players trigger abilities from their played Earth cards that match the action.

Turns Continue Until a Player Has a 4x4 Grid:

The game ends when any player completes their 16-card tableau.

Final scoring includes Fauna objectives, Ecosystem goals, and resource conversions.

Winning: The player with the most points from cards, sprouts, growth, compost, and objectives wins!

Game: The Castles of Mad King Ludwig
